docs.title: Welcome to Pictastic.ai Docs
docs.text:
Pictastic.ai Docs is your complete guide to hosting, sharing, and selling real estate media with cutting‑edge tools for AI virtual staging and custom-branded delivery.

Launch App Sign Up

docs.title: What is Pictastic.ai?
docs.text:
Pictastic.ai is a full‑service platform that lets you host, share, and monetize your real estate media. With our solution you can:

  • ✓ Deliver Photos: Host and deliver high‑quality images.
  • ✓ Host Video: Stream and share property videos seamlessly.
  • ✓ Responsive Layouts: Enjoy designs that look great on every device.
  • ✓ Deliver Virtual Tours: Create immersive, AI‑powered virtual staging experiences.
  • ✓ Build Property Websites: Instantly generate branded project sites.
  • ✓ Monetize Media: Require payment to unlock your media content.

Get Started

docs.title: How Does Pictastic.ai Work?
docs.text:
Our intuitive drag‑and‑drop builder makes it easy to create and customize your project websites. With Pictastic.ai you can:

  • Custom Media Delivery: Tailor the presentation of your photos, videos, and more.
  • Replace Old Tools: Move beyond outdated solutions like Google Drive and Dropbox.
  • Private Label URLs: Deliver media on your own custom domain.
  • Pay to Unlock: Securely monetize your media with a simple payment mechanism.

Learn More

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Custom domain functionality allows you to brand your Pictastic.ai galleries and virtual staging presentations with your own domain name (e.g., gallery.yourcompany.com instead of gallery.pictastic.ai). This feature is available for Professional and Enterprise plan subscribers.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Set up custom subdomains for property galleries
  • Configure DNS settings
  • SSL certificate management
  • Automatic HTTPS enforcement
  • White-labeled presentation URLs

docs.title: 1. Domain Setup
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Account Settings > Custom Domain
  2. Click "Add Custom Domain"
  3. Enter your desired subdomain (e.g., gallery.yourcompany.com)
  4. Click "Verify Domain"

docs.title: 2. DNS Configuration
docs.text:
Add the following DNS records to your domain provider's settings:

Type: CNAME
Host: gallery
Value: custom.pictastic.ai
TTL: 3600 (or automatic)

docs.title: 3. Verification
docs.text:
1. After adding DNS records, return to Pictastic.ai
  2. Click "Verify DNS Settings"
  3. Wait for verification (may take up to 24 hours)

docs.title: 4. SSL Certificate
docs.text:
• SSL certificate is automatically provisioned
  • Allow up to 1 hour for SSL certificate generation
  • Certificate auto-renews 30 days before expiration

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Domain Selection
  2. Use a memorable subdomain
  3. Avoid using numbers or special characters

  4. Keep the subdomain short and professional

  5. DNS Management

  6. Document your DNS changes
  7. Use recommended TTL values

  8. Maintain backup of previous DNS settings

  9. Testing

  10. Verify SSL certificate status
  11. Test gallery links after setup

  12. Check mobile compatibility

  13. Monitoring

  14. Regular SSL certificate checks
  15. Monitor domain status
  16. Set up alerts for domain expiration

docs.title: DNS Requirements
docs.text:
• CNAME record pointing to custom.pictastic.ai
  • Support for HTTPS/SSL
  • Compatible with major DNS providers

docs.title: SSL Specifications
docs.text:
• 2048-bit SSL certificates
  • Auto-renewal enabled
  • Valid for 12 months
  • Compliant with modern security standards

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Maximum 5 custom domains per account (Professional plan)
  • Unlimited domains for Enterprise plans
  • Subdomain length: 3-63 characters
  • DNS propagation: up to 24 hours

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text:
ERROR_CODE_1001: Invalid domain format
ERROR_CODE_1002: DNS verification failed
ERROR_CODE_1003: SSL generation failed
ERROR_CODE_1004: Domain limit exceeded

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
Custom domains can be managed via API: 

POST /api/v1/custom-domains
GET /api/v1/custom-domains
DELETE /api/v1/custom-domains/{domain_id}

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
For assistance with custom domain setup: - Email: support@pictastic.ai - Support hours: Monday-Friday, 9 AM - 5 PM EST - Priority support for Enterprise customers

Note: Custom domain feature requires an active Professional or Enterprise subscription. Domain and SSL certificate management is included in the subscription fee.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The Account/Profile section in Pictastic.ai allows users to manage their personal information, subscription settings, and platform preferences. This central hub enables real estate professionals to maintain their business identity and customize their experience within the platform.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Profile information management
  • Subscription and billing controls
  • API key management
  • Team member access settings
  • Notification preferences
  • Usage statistics and history
  • Brand customization options

docs.title: Accessing Your Profile
docs.text:
1. Click the profile icon in the top-right corner
  2. Select "Account Settings" from the dropdown menu

docs.title: Managing Profile Information
docs.text:
Profile > Personal Information
- Update name, email, and contact details
- Change profile picture
- Modify company information
- Set timezone and language preferences

docs.title: Subscription Management
docs.text:
Profile > Subscription
- View current plan
- Upgrade/downgrade subscription
- Update billing information
- Download invoices
- View usage metrics

docs.title: Security Settings
docs.text:
Profile > Security
- Change password
- Enable/disable two-factor authentication
- Manage active sessions
- View login history

docs.title: Team Access Control
docs.text:
Profile > Team
- Invite team members
- Set role permissions
- Manage access levels
- Remove team members

docs.title: Profile Setup
docs.text:
• Use a professional profile photo
  • Provide complete business information
  • Keep contact details current
  • Enable two-factor authentication

docs.title: Team Management
docs.text:
• Regularly review team member access
  • Assign appropriate permission levels
  • Remove inactive users promptly
  • Document role assignments

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
• Change passwords every 90 days
  • Use strong passwords (min. 12 characters)
  • Review login history monthly
  • Keep API keys secure

docs.title: API Access
docs.text:
Endpoint: api.pictastic.ai/v1/profile
Methods: GET, PUT, PATCH
Authentication: Bearer token required

docs.title: Data Storage
docs.text:
• Profile data: encrypted at rest
  • Passwords: hashed using bcrypt
  • Files: stored in AWS S3
  • Session timeout: 24 hours

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text:
API Requests:
- Free tier: 1000 requests/day
- Professional: 10000 requests/day
- Enterprise: Unlimited

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
• Profile images: JPG, PNG (max 5MB)
  • Documents: PDF (max 10MB)
  • Data export: JSON, CSV

docs.title: Integration Options
docs.text:
- REST API
- Webhook notifications
- SSO (Enterprise only)
- OAuth 2.0 authentication

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
1. Profile changes not saving
  2. Clear browser cache
  3. Check internet connection

  4. Verify form validation

  5. Team invite failures

  6. Confirm email accuracy
  7. Check license limitations

  8. Verify domain restrictions

  9. API key issues

  10. Regenerate key
  11. Check rate limits
  12. Verify permissions

docs.title: Support Channels
docs.text:
• Email: support@pictastic.ai
  • Help Center: help.pictastic.ai
  • Live Chat: Available 9am-5pm EST
  • Phone: +1 (555) 123-4567

For additional assistance or feature requests, contact our support team or visit our help center.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The account and subscription management system in Pictastic.ai allows users to control their account settings, manage subscription plans, and monitor usage. This system ensures seamless access to virtual staging and media management features based on the user's subscription level.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Account profile management
  • Subscription plan selection and modification
  • Usage tracking and analytics
  • Billing history and invoice access
  • Team member management (Business and Enterprise plans)
  • API key management (Enterprise plan)

docs.title: Managing Your Account
docs.text:
1. Access Account Settings
  2. Click on your profile icon in the top-right corner

  3. Select "Account Settings" from the dropdown menu

  4. Update Profile Information

  5. Navigate to the "Profile" tab
  6. Modify your name, email, company details, or password

  7. Click "Save Changes" to apply updates

  8. Subscription Management

  9. Go to the "Subscription" tab
  10. View current plan details and usage statistics

  11. Upgrade or downgrade subscription:

    1. Click "Change Plan"
    2. Select desired plan
    3. Confirm billing details
    4. Complete payment process

  12. Billing Information

  13. Access "Billing History" tab
  14. View past invoices
  15. Update payment method:
    1. Click "Payment Methods"
    2. Add or modify credit card information
    3. Set default payment method

docs.title: Team Management
docs.text:
Business Plan:
- Add team member: Settings > Team > "Add Member"
- Set role permissions: Admin, Editor, or Viewer
- Remove team member: Team > Member > "Remove"

Enterprise Plan:
- Additional custom role creation
- Bulk team member import via CSV
- SSO configuration

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Account Security
  2. Enable two-factor authentication
  3. Use strong, unique passwords

  4. Regularly review active sessions

  5. Subscription Management

  6. Monitor usage analytics monthly
  7. Set usage alerts at 80% threshold

  8. Review team member access quarterly

  9. Billing Efficiency

  10. Enable auto-renewal
  11. Keep payment information updated

  12. Download invoices monthly for accounting

  13. Team Organization

  14. Implement clear naming conventions
  15. Assign appropriate role levels
  16. Document team member responsibilities

docs.title: API Access
docs.text:
Endpoint: api.pictastic.ai/v1/account
Authentication: Bearer token
Rate Limit: 100 requests/minute

docs.title: Subscription Tiers
docs.text:
Basic:
  - 50 renders/month
  - 5GB storage
  - Basic support

Professional:
  - 200 renders/month
  - 25GB storage
  - Priority support
  - Advanced features

Business:
  - 1000 renders/month
  - 100GB storage
  - Premium support
  - Team features
  - API access

Enterprise:
  - Custom renders/month
  - Unlimited storage
  - Dedicated support
  - Custom features
  - Advanced API access

docs.title: Data Storage
docs.text:
• Profile data: encrypted at rest (AES-256)
  • Payment information: PCI DSS compliant
  • Session management: JWT tokens
  • Backup frequency: Daily

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browsers (Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+)
  • Minimum 2Mbps internet connection
  • Cookies enabled
  • JavaScript enabled

For additional support or technical questions, contact support@pictastic.ai or visit our Help Center.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Albums in Pictastic.ai allow real estate professionals to organize, manage, and share collections of property images. Albums serve as containers for both original and virtually staged photos, making it easy to keep property listings organized and accessible.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Create unlimited albums for different properties
  • Custom naming and organization
  • Batch upload capabilities (up to 50 images per upload)
  • Share albums with clients and team members
  • Track image modifications and staging history
  • Sort and filter images within albums
  • Set album privacy settings

docs.title: Creating a New Album
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Albums section in your dashboard
  2. Click the "+ New Album" button
  3. Enter the album name (e.g., "123 Main Street")
  4. Select privacy settings (Private/Team/Public)
  5. Click "Create"

docs.title: Adding Images to an Album
docs.text:
1. Open the desired album
  2. Click "Upload Images" or drag and drop files
  3. Select images from your computer (supported formats: JPG, PNG, HEIC)
  4. Wait for upload completion
  5. Images will automatically be processed for optimization

docs.title: Managing Album Settings
docs.text:
1. Click the gear icon within the album
  2. Modify album properties:
  3. Name
  4. Description
  5. Privacy settings
  6. Collaboration permissions
  7. Save changes

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Naming Convention: Use consistent naming (e.g., "Address - Date" or "ProjectID - PropertyName")
  • Organization: Create separate albums for:
  • Different properties
  • Before/after staging comparisons
  • Client-specific collections
  • Image Management:
  • Upload high-resolution images (minimum 1920x1080)
  • Keep original photos in a separate subfolder
  • Tag images appropriately for easy searching

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Individual album capacity: 500 images
  • Maximum image size: 25MB per file
  • Total storage varies by subscription plan

docs.title: Supported File Formats
docs.text:
• Images: JPG, PNG, HEIC, TIFF
  • Maximum dimensions: 8000x8000 pixels
  • Minimum dimensions: 800x600 pixels

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
  • Minimum internet speed: 5Mbps upload
  • Recommended: 10Mbps+ for optimal performance

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
POST /api/v1/albums
{
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "privacy": "private|team|public",
  "settings": {
    "allowComments": boolean,
    "enableVersioning": boolean
  }
}

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
• Automatic retry for failed uploads
  • Notification system for upload status
  • Error logs available in album settings

For additional support or technical queries, contact our support team at support@pictastic.ai.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Albums in Pictastic.ai provide a systematic way to organize, store, and manage real estate media content. Each album functions as a container for related photos, virtual stagings, and other media assets associated with a specific property or project.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Create, rename, and delete albums
  • Upload multiple media files simultaneously
  • Sort and filter content within albums
  • Share album contents with team members
  • Track version history of edited images
  • Apply batch operations to multiple files
  • Set access permissions per album

docs.title: Creating a New Album
docs.text:
1. Click the "+" button in the Albums sidebar
  2. Enter album name and optional description
  3. Select sharing preferences
  4. Click "Create Album"

docs.title: Adding Content
docs.text:
Method 1: Drag and Drop
- Simply drag files from your computer into the album

Method 2: Upload Button
1. Click "Upload" in the album view
2. Select files from your device
3. Click "Open" to begin upload

docs.title: Organizing Content
docs.text:
1. Select files by clicking thumbnails
  2. Use the toolbar to:
  3. Move to another album
  4. Delete selected items
  5. Download files
  6. Apply batch edits
  7. Change viewing options

docs.title: Managing Access
docs.text:
1. Click "Album Settings" (gear icon)
  2. Select "Sharing & Permissions"
  3. Add team members or clients
  4. Set appropriate access levels:
  5. View Only
  6. Edit
  7. Admin

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Use consistent naming conventions for albums
  • Create separate albums for different properties
  • Keep original and edited versions in designated folders
  • Archive completed projects regularly

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
• Limit album size to 500 files for optimal performance
  • Use compressed versions for sharing
  • Clean up unused files periodically

docs.title: Collaboration
docs.text:
• Set clear access permissions
  • Use comments for team communication
  • Track versions when making edits
  • Share preview links instead of downloading files

docs.title: Supported File Types
docs.text:
• Images: JPG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
  • Videos: MP4, MOV
  • 3D Tours: OBJ, GLB
  • Documents: PDF

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Free tier: 5GB per album
  • Professional: 50GB per album
  • Enterprise: Unlimited

docs.title: File Specifications
docs.text:
• Maximum file size: 100MB
  • Recommended image resolution: 4000x3000px
  • Video quality: Up to 4K

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text:
• End-to-end encryption
  • Version control
  • Access logging
  • Automatic backup
  • Two-factor authentication for sensitive operations

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
{
  "endpoint": "/api/v1/albums",
  "methods": ["GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE"],
  "authentication": "Bearer token required"
}

For more detailed API documentation, visit our Developer Portal.

Note: Features and limits may vary based on your subscription plan. Contact support for specific details about your account capabilities.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Albums in Pictastic.ai provide a structured way to organize, manage, and share real estate media assets. Albums function as containers for photos, virtually staged images, floor plans, and other property-related media, allowing real estate professionals to keep content organized by property listing or project.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Media Organization: Group related images and media files into dedicated albums
  • Batch Operations: Perform actions on multiple files simultaneously
  • Sharing Controls: Set permissions and generate shareable links
  • Version Management: Track changes and maintain multiple versions of edited images
  • Sorting & Filtering: Organize media using custom tags, dates, and properties
  • Collaboration: Allow team members to access and contribute to shared albums

docs.title: Creating an Album
docs.text:
1. Click the "New Album" button in the top navigation
  2. Enter album name and optional description
  3. Set visibility settings (Private/Team/Public)
  4. Click "Create"

docs.title: Adding Media
docs.text:
1. Open the desired album
  2. Click "Upload" or drag files directly into the album
  3. Select files from your computer
  4. Wait for upload completion

docs.title: Managing Content
docs.text:
1. Select files by clicking checkboxes
  2. Use the action bar to:
  3. Move to another album
  4. Download selected files
  5. Delete files
  6. Apply batch edits
  7. Share content

docs.title: Sharing Albums
docs.text:
1. Click "Share" on the album
  2. Choose sharing method:
  3. Generate link
  4. Invite team members
  5. Set password protection
  6. Set permission levels (View/Edit)
  7. Copy link or send invitations

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Create separate albums for each property listing
  • Use consistent naming conventions
  • Add descriptive tags for easy searching
  • Keep album structure flat when possible

docs.title: Storage Management
docs.text:
• Regular cleanup of unused media
  • Archive completed projects
  • Compress large files before upload
  • Remove duplicate content

docs.title: Collaboration
docs.text:
• Set clear access permissions
  • Use comments for team communication
  • Maintain version control
  • Document any specific requirements

docs.title: Supported File Types
docs.text:
• Images: JPG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
  • Videos: MP4, MOV
  • Documents: PDF
  • 3D Models: OBJ, GLB

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Individual file size: 100MB
  • Album capacity: 1000 files
  • Total storage varies by subscription plan

docs.title: Performance Specifications
docs.text:
• Upload speed: Up to 10 files simultaneously
  • Processing time: 2-5 seconds per image
  • Auto-optimization for web delivery

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text:
• End-to-end encryption
  • Access logging
  • Two-factor authentication support
  • Regular backup systems

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
• RESTful API available
  • Webhook support for automation
  • Custom integration options
  • Batch processing capabilities

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
  • Minimum 10Mbps internet connection
  • JavaScript enabled
  • Cookies enabled for session management

For additional support or technical queries, please contact our support team or refer to the API documentation.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The Album Sharing feature in Pictastic.ai enables users to create, manage, and share collections of real estate media with clients, team members, and stakeholders. Albums can contain photos, virtual stagings, floor plans, and 360° tours in an organized, easily accessible format.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Create unlimited albums
  • Share via unique URLs or direct email invites
  • Set custom permissions and access levels
  • Track viewing analytics
  • Enable/disable downloads
  • Set expiration dates
  • Custom branding options
  • Bulk media management
  • Real-time collaboration

docs.title: Creating an Album
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Albums section in the dashboard
  2. Click "Create New Album"
  3. Enter album details:
  4. Album name
  5. Description (optional)
  6. Cover image (optional)
  7. Access settings

docs.title: Adding Media
docs.text:
1. Open the desired album
  2. Click "Add Media" button
  3. Choose from:
  4. Upload new files
  5. Select from existing library
  6. Import from other albums
  7. Arrange media by dragging and dropping

docs.title: Sharing Settings
docs.text:
1. Click "Share" on any album
  2. Configure sharing options: 
    - View only
- Download enabled
- Comment permissions
- Password protection
- Expiration date
  3. Choose sharing method:
  4. Generate shareable link
  5. Send email invite
  6. Embed code

docs.title: Managing Access
docs.text:
1. Access "Album Settings"
  2. Select "Manage Access"
  3. Add/remove users or teams
  4. Set permission levels:
  5. Admin
  6. Editor
  7. Viewer

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Use consistent naming conventions
  • Create separate albums for different properties
  • Utilize tags and categories
  • Keep album sizes manageable (recommended max: 500 items)

docs.title: Sharing
docs.text:
• Set appropriate expiration dates for time-sensitive content
  • Use password protection for sensitive materials
  • Disable downloads when sharing with prospects
  • Enable watermarking for public shares

docs.title: Maintenance
docs.text:
• Regular cleanup of expired albums
  • Archive completed projects
  • Monitor storage usage
  • Review access permissions periodically

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
• Images: JPG, PNG, TIFF, WebP
  • Videos: MP4, MOV
  • 360° Tours: HTML5
  • Documents: PDF

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Individual file size: 100MB
  • Album size: 10GB
  • Total account storage varies by plan

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text:
{
  "encryption": "AES-256",
  "access_control": "Role-based",
  "authentication": "JWT tokens",
  "watermarking": "Real-time",
  "audit_logging": true
}

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
Albums can be managed via REST API: 

GET /api/v1/albums
POST /api/v1/albums
PUT /api/v1/albums/{id}
DELETE /api/v1/albums/{id}

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
• CDN-powered delivery
  • Automatic image optimization
  • Lazy loading
  • Progressive loading for large albums

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
  • Minimum 2Mbps internet connection
  • JavaScript enabled
  • Cookies enabled for authentication

For additional support or custom integration needs, contact technical support at support@pictastic.ai.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The customization and branding features allow real estate professionals to maintain consistent brand identity across all media assets managed through Pictastic.ai. Users can customize various elements including watermarks, color schemes, logos, and branded templates for virtual staging and property marketing materials.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Custom watermark placement and styling
  • Brand color scheme implementation
  • Logo integration
  • Custom templates for virtual staging
  • Branded export presets
  • Multi-brand profile management
  • White-label options for enterprise users

docs.title: Setting Up Brand Profiles
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Settings > Brand Management
  2. Click Create New Brand Profile
  3. Fill in the following required fields:
  4. Brand name
  5. Primary color (HEX/RGB)
  6. Secondary color (HEX/RGB)
  7. Logo upload (PNG/SVG, min 300px width)

docs.title: Configuring Watermarks
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Watermark Settings
  2. Upload your watermark image (PNG with transparency)
  3. Configure placement options:
  4. Position (9 anchor points available)
  5. Size (percentage of image width)
  6. Opacity (0-100%)
  7. Margin from edges (px)

docs.title: Creating Branded Templates
docs.text:
1. Access Templates > Create New
  2. Choose template type:
  3. Virtual staging
  4. Property listing
  5. Social media post
  6. Customize template elements:
  7. Background
  8. Text styles
  9. Logo placement
  10. Color scheme
  11. Save template to your library

docs.title: Watermarks
docs.text:
• Use PNG format with transparency
  • Keep design simple and legible
  • Maintain reasonable size (recommended: 10-15% of image width)
  • Consider placement that doesn't interfere with key image elements

docs.title: Logos
docs.text:
• Upload vector formats (SVG) when possible
  • Provide both light and dark versions
  • Maintain minimum clear space around logo
  • Keep file sizes under 1MB

docs.title: Color Schemes
docs.text:
• Define primary and secondary colors
  • Include complementary accent colors
  • Consider contrast ratios for accessibility
  • Document color codes (HEX/RGB) for consistency

docs.title: Templates
docs.text:
• Create templates for common use cases
  • Test templates across different image sizes
  • Keep designs clean and professional
  • Include variable fields for dynamic content

docs.title: Supported File Formats
docs.text:
• Images: PNG, JPG, TIFF
  • Vectors: SVG, AI
  • Logos: PNG, SVG
  • Watermarks: PNG with transparency

docs.title: Resolution Requirements
docs.text:
• Logos: Minimum 300px width

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The Customization & Themes system in Pictastic.ai allows users to create, manage, and apply consistent visual styles across their real estate media projects. Users can customize colors, fonts, watermarks, and branding elements to maintain brand consistency across virtual staging and property presentations.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Theme Presets: Pre-defined style combinations for quick application
  • Custom Theme Creation: Build and save personalized themes
  • Branding Elements: Upload and manage logos, watermarks, and brand assets
  • Color Schemes: Define primary, secondary, and accent colors
  • Typography Settings: Set font families and styles for different content types
  • Export/Import: Share themes across team members or projects

docs.title: Creating a New Theme
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Settings > Themes
  2. Click "Create New Theme"
  3. Enter theme name and description
  4. Configure the following elements:
  5. Color palette
  6. Typography
  7. Logo placement
  8. Watermark settings
  9. Click "Save Theme"

docs.title: Applying Themes
docs.text:
1. Open your project
  2. Select "Theme" from the toolbar
  3. Choose from:
  4. Saved themes
  5. System presets
  6. Recently used
  7. Click "Apply Theme"

docs.title: Managing Brand Assets
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Brand Assets
  2. Upload your assets:
  3. Company logo (PNG/SVG, max 5MB)
  4. Watermark (PNG with transparency)
  5. Custom fonts (TTF/OTF format)
  6. Set default positions and scaling

docs.title: Theme Organization
docs.text:
• Use descriptive names for themes (e.g., "Luxury Properties Dark Mode")
  • Create separate themes for different property types
  • Document color codes and font choices
  • Regular backup of custom themes

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Keep image assets under 2MB
  • Use vector formats (SVG) for logos when possible
  • Limit custom font usage to 3 fonts per theme
  • Compress images before uploading

docs.title: Brand Consistency
docs.text:
• Maintain consistent color schemes across themes
  • Use standard logo positions
  • Define clear typography hierarchies
  • Document brand guidelines within theme descriptions

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
• Images: PNG, JPG, SVG
  • Fonts: TTF, OTF, WOFF2
  • Color formats: HEX, RGB, RGBA

docs.title: Theme Structure
docs.text:
{
  "themeId": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "colors": {
    "primary": "#HEXCODE",
    "secondary": "#HEXCODE",
    "accent": "#HEXCODE"
  },
  "typography": {
    "headings": {
      "fontFamily": "string",
      "fontSize": "number",
      "fontWeight": "number"
    },
    "body": {
      "fontFamily": "string",
      "fontSize": "number"
    }
  },
  "branding": {
    "logo": {
      "url": "string",
      "position": "string",
      "scale": "number"
    },
    "watermark": {
      "url": "string",
      "opacity": "number"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Size Limitations
docs.text:
• Maximum logo size: 5MB
  • Maximum watermark size: 2MB
  • Maximum custom fonts: 3 per theme
  • Maximum themes per account: 50

docs.title: Cache Management
docs.text:
• Themes are cached locally
  • Asset CDN delivery
  • Automatic sync across devices
  • Version control for theme updates

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
// Apply theme to project
POST /api/v1/projects/{projectId}/theme
{
  "themeId": "theme_uuid",
  "customizations": {}
}

// Create new theme
POST /api/v1/themes
{
  "name": "Theme Name",
  "settings": {}
}

Remember to regularly update themes and assets to ensure optimal performance and consistency across your real estate media projects.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Pictastic.ai is a comprehensive real estate media management and virtual staging platform designed for real estate professionals. The platform combines AI-powered editing tools, virtual staging capabilities, and media organization features to streamline property marketing workflows.

docs.title: Core Components
docs.text:
• Media Management Dashboard
  • AI Virtual Staging Engine
  • Batch Processing Tools
  • Property-specific Organization System
  • Multi-format Export Options

docs.title: Media Management
docs.text:
• Upload and organize photos by property listing
  • Automatic image enhancement and correction
  • Custom folder structures and tagging system
  • Bulk editing and processing capabilities

docs.title: Virtual Staging
docs.text:
• One-click room type detection
  • 20+ furniture style collections
  • Custom furniture placement and arrangement
  • Lighting and shadow adjustment
  • Room measurement calibration

docs.title: Collaboration
docs.text:
• Team sharing and permissions
  • Client preview links
  • Comment and revision tracking
  • Real-time collaboration tools

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Create your account at app.pictastic.ai
  2. Verify your email address
  3. Complete your organization profile
  4. Add team members (if applicable)

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text: Upload Photos → Organize by Property → Edit/Stage → Export → Share

docs.title: Quick Start Steps
docs.text:
1. Upload Photos
  2. Drag and drop files into the dashboard
  3. Select multiple files for batch upload

  4. Maximum file size: 25MB per image

  5. Organization

  6. Create a new property listing
  7. Add property details
  8. Assign photos to rooms/spaces

  9. Apply relevant tags

  10. Editing and Staging

  11. Select photos for enhancement
  12. Choose staging style
  13. Adjust furniture placement

  14. Fine-tune lighting and colors

  15. Export and Share

  16. Select export format (JPG, PNG, TIFF)
  17. Choose resolution and quality
  18. Generate shareable links
  19. Download processed images

docs.title: Image Quality
docs.text:
• Upload high-resolution images (minimum 2000px wide)
  • Use well-lit photos for better AI processing
  • Maintain consistent aspect ratios
  • Shoot rooms from corner angles when possible

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Use consistent naming conventions
  • Create templates for common property types
  • Maintain folder hierarchies
  • Regular backup of important assets

docs.title: Workflow Optimization
docs.text:
• Batch process similar images together
  • Use keyboard shortcuts for frequent actions
  • Create preset staging arrangements
  • Schedule large uploads during off-peak hours

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
• Input: JPG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
  • Output: JPG, PNG, TIFF
  • Maximum resolution: 8000 x 8000 pixels

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser (Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+)
  • Minimum 8GB RAM
  • Stable internet connection (10+ Mbps recommended)
  • WebGL 2.0 support

// Basic API endpoint structure
https://api.pictastic.ai/v1/{endpoint}

// Authentication
Authorization: Bearer {your_api_key}

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Free tier: 5GB storage
  • Professional: 100GB storage
  • Enterprise: Custom storage limits

docs.title: Processing Capabilities
docs.text:
• Batch processing: Up to 100 images
  • Maximum processing time: 5 minutes per image
  • Concurrent operations: Based on subscription tier

For detailed API documentation and advanced features, please visit our Developer Portal.

Note: Features and limits may vary based on your subscription plan. Contact support@pictastic.ai for specific inquiries.

docs.title: 1. Feature Overview
docs.text:
The Media Storage system in Pictastic.ai is a centralized repository for managing all real estate media assets, including: - High-resolution property photos - Virtually staged images - Floor plans - 360° virtual tours - Property videos - Marketing materials

The system supports secure cloud storage with automatic backup, version control, and intelligent organization based on properties and projects.

docs.title: 2. Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Intelligent Organization: Automatically sorts media by property address, date, and type
  • Version Control: Maintains original and edited versions of all media assets
  • Batch Operations: Upload, download, and edit multiple files simultaneously
  • Smart Search: Find media using filters, tags, or text search
  • Access Control: Manage user permissions for viewing and editing media
  • Integration: Direct connection with editing tools and virtual staging features

docs.title: Uploading Media
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Media Storage dashboard
2. Click "Upload" or drag files into the upload zone
3. Select property association from dropdown
4. Add relevant tags (optional)
5. Click "Confirm Upload"

docs.title: Organizing Media
docs.text:
1. Select files to organize
2. Choose "Organize" from the action menu
3. Select or create folders
4. Apply tags and metadata
5. Save changes

docs.title: Sharing Media
docs.text:
1. Select media files
2. Click "Share"
3. Choose sharing method:
   - Generate shareable link
   - Email directly
   - Add to MLS package
4. Set permissions and expiration (if applicable)
5. Confirm sharing settings

docs.title: File Management
docs.text:
• Use consistent naming conventions (e.g., PropertyAddress_Room_Date)
  • Apply relevant tags immediately upon upload
  • Regular cleanup of unused or outdated media
  • Maintain original files in a separate folder

docs.title: Storage Optimization
docs.text:
• Compress large files before upload (recommended max size: 20MB)
  • Use appropriate file formats:
  • Photos: JPEG for web, TIFF for print
  • Floor plans: PDF or PNG
  • Videos: MP4 (H.264 codec)

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Create logical folder structures by property
  • Use standardized tag categories:
  • Room type (kitchen, bathroom, etc.)
  • Photo type (exterior, interior, aerial)
  • Status (staged, unstaged, edited)

docs.title: Supported File Formats
docs.text:
• Images: JPEG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
  • Videos: MP4, MOV
  • Documents: PDF, DOCX
  • 3D Tours: OBJ, FBX

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Standard Plan: 100GB per account
  • Professional Plan: 500GB per account
  • Enterprise Plan: Custom storage limits

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
// Example API endpoint for media upload
POST /api/v1/media/upload
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

// Example response
{
  "status": "success",
  "mediaId": "m123456",
  "url": "https://storage.pictastic.ai/m123456"
}

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text:
• AES-256 encryption at rest
  • SSL/TLS encryption in transit
  • Multi-factor authentication for sensitive operations
  • Automated backup every 24 hours
  • Geographic redundancy across multiple data centers

docs.title: Performance Specifications
docs.text:
• Maximum file size: 2GB
  • Concurrent uploads: Up to 10 files
  • Processing time: < 3 seconds per MB
  • CDN-enabled delivery
  • Auto-scaling storage capacity

For additional support or technical questions, contact technical support at support@pictastic.ai or visit our developer portal at developers.pictastic.ai.

docs.title: 1. Feature Overview
docs.text: The Media Upload & Organization system in Pictastic.ai enables users to efficiently upload, manage, and organize real estate media assets. This feature supports batch uploads, automatic categorization, and hierarchical organization of photos, virtual stagings, and floor plans.

docs.title: 2. Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Bulk Upload Support: Upload up to 100 images simultaneously
  • Auto-categorization: AI-powered detection of room types and image categories
  • Organization Structure: Projects > Properties > Room Categories
  • Format Support: JPG, PNG, TIFF (up to 25MB per file)
  • Drag-and-drop Interface: Intuitive media management
  • Smart Tagging: Automatic and manual tagging capabilities
  • Version Control: Track changes and maintain multiple versions

docs.title: Uploading Media
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Media Library
  2. Select "Upload" or drag files into the upload zone

  4. Single property or batch upload
  5. Auto-categorization preference

docs.title: Organizing Media

  2. Use the "Organize" tool to:
  3. Create room categories
  4. Set display order

docs.title: Managing Assets
docs.text:
1. Select media items
  2. Use the toolbar to:
  3. Edit metadata
  4. Apply tags
  5. Move/copy to other folders
  6. Download or share

docs.title: File Management
docs.text:
• Use consistent naming conventions
  • Create property folders before uploading

docs.title: Organization

  • Apply relevant tags immediately

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The Project Sites customization module allows real estate professionals to personalize their client-facing property showcase pages. This feature enables users to create branded, professional property websites that match their company's identity while presenting property media and virtual staging in an engaging way.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Custom domain integration
  • Brand color scheme customization
  • Logo upload and placement options
  • Header and footer customization
  • Navigation menu configuration
  • Custom CSS implementation
  • Mobile responsiveness settings
  • Contact form customization
  • Social media integration
  • Analytics tracking

docs.title: Accessing Customization Settings
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Settings > Project Sites
  2. Select the project site you wish to customize
  3. Click "Customize" to open the visual editor

docs.title: Basic Customization
docs.text:
1. Brand Colors
   - Primary color: Used for buttons and key elements
   - Secondary color: Used for accents and highlights
   - Background color: Sets the main background tone

2. Logo Settings
   - Upload logo (supported formats: PNG, SVG, JPEG)
   - Set logo dimensions (recommended: 200x60px)
   - Choose logo placement (left, center, right)

3. Typography
   - Select header font
   - Select body font
   - Adjust font sizes for different elements

docs.title: Advanced Customization
docs.text:
1. Custom CSS
   - Access CSS editor via Advanced > Custom CSS
   - Add custom styles using provided selectors
   - Test changes in preview mode before publishing

2. Layout Configuration
   - Adjust grid layout (2-4 columns)
   - Set image aspect ratios
   - Configure spacing between elements

3. Contact Form
   - Add/remove form fields
   - Set required fields
   - Customize form submission actions

docs.title: Design Guidelines
docs.text:
• Maintain consistent branding across all project sites
  • Ensure sufficient contrast between text and background
  • Keep navigation simple and intuitive
  • Test customization on multiple devices
  • Limit custom CSS to necessary modifications

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Compress images before upload
  • Minimize custom CSS
  • Use provided templates as starting points
  • Test load times after customization

docs.title: Content Organization
docs.text:
• Group similar properties together
  • Use clear, descriptive headings
  • Implement logical navigation structure
  • Include clear calls-to-action

docs.title: Supported Browsers
docs.text:
• Chrome (latest 2 versions)
  • Firefox (latest 2 versions)
  • Safari (latest 2 versions)
  • Edge (latest 2 versions)

docs.title: File Specifications
docs.text:
Images:
- Maximum file size: 5MB

Custom CSS:

2. Subdomains

- Google Analytics 4 support
- Facebook Pixel integration

docs.title: Security Features

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Project Sites are dedicated workspaces within Pictastic.ai that allow real estate professionals to organize, manage, and share media assets for specific properties. Each project site functions as a centralized hub for property photos, virtual staging, floor plans, and marketing materials.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Media Organization: Sort and categorize property photos, virtual stagings, and marketing assets
  • Collaboration Tools: Share access with team members, clients, and stakeholders
  • Version Control: Track changes and maintain multiple versions of staged photos
  • Access Management: Control viewing and editing permissions for different user roles
  • Automated Organization: Smart folders and AI-powered photo categorization
  • Direct Sharing: Generate shareable links for individual assets or entire projects

docs.title: Creating a New Project Site
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Dashboard
  2. Click "Create New Project" button
  3. Enter project details:
  4. Project name
  5. Property address
  6. Project type (Residential/Commercial)
  7. Client information
  8. Click "Create" to generate the project site

docs.title: Managing Media
docs.text:
1. Upload Files
  2. Drag and drop files into the project area
  3. Use the "Upload" button to select files

  4. Bulk upload via ZIP files

  5. Organize Content

  6. Create custom folders
  7. Use smart folders for automatic categorization

  8. Add tags and labels for easy searching

  9. Share Access

  10. Click "Share" button
  11. Enter email addresses of team members
  12. Set permission levels (View/Edit/Admin)
  13. Generate shareable links with expiration dates

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Create consistent folder structures across projects
  • Use descriptive file names (e.g., "master-bedroom-staged-v1")
  • Apply relevant tags for efficient searching
  • Archive completed projects instead of deleting them

docs.title: Collaboration
docs.text:
• Assign clear roles and permissions to team members
  • Use the commenting feature for feedback
  • Set up notification preferences for important updates
  • Regular cleanup of unused assets

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
• Review access permissions regularly
  • Use expiring links for external sharing
  • Enable two-factor authentication
  • Log out from shared devices

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Standard plan: 50GB per project
  • Professional plan: 250GB per project
  • Enterprise plan: Unlimited storage

docs.title: Supported File Types
docs.text:
• Images: JPG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
  • Documents: PDF, DOC, DOCX
  • Videos: MP4, MOV (up to 2GB per file)

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
  • Minimum 10Mbps internet connection
  • Display resolution: 1920x1080 or higher

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
// Example API endpoint for project creation
POST /api/v1/projects
{
  "name": "123 Main Street",
  "type": "residential",
  "client_id": "client_12345",
  "address": {
    "street": "123 Main Street",
    "city": "Springfield",
    "state": "IL",
    "zip": "62701"
  }
}

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Automatic image compression
  • Progressive loading for large galleries
  • CDN distribution for faster access
  • Background processing for bulk operations

For additional support or feature requests, contact our technical support team at support@pictastic.ai or visit our help center at help.pictastic.ai.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Project Sites enables real estate professionals to create customized, mobile-responsive property websites for individual listings or entire developments. Each website automatically syncs with your Pictastic.ai media assets and can be shared with a unique URL.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Instant Website Generation: Create branded property websites in minutes
  • Media Synchronization: Automatic syncing with your Pictastic.ai photo galleries, virtual stagings, and 360° tours
  • Custom Domain Support: Use your own domain or our provided subdomain (yourname.pictastic.ai)
  • Lead Capture: Built-in contact forms and lead management system
  • Analytics Dashboard: Track visitor engagement and lead statistics
  • Mobile Optimization: Responsive design works across all devices

docs.title: Creating a New Property Website
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Dashboard > Project Sites
  2. Click "Create New Site"
  3. Select a template or start from scratch
  4. Enter property details:
  5. Address
  6. Price
  7. Description
  8. Features
  9. Agent information

docs.title: Adding Media
docs.text:
1. Select "Media Gallery" tab
  2. Choose from your existing Pictastic.ai assets or upload new ones
  3. Drag and drop to arrange media order
  4. Add captions and alt text for SEO

docs.title: Customizing Design
docs.text:
1. Click "Design Settings"
  2. Modify:
  3. Color scheme
  4. Typography
  5. Layout options
  6. Header style
  7. Contact form placement

docs.title: Publishing
docs.text:
1. Preview your site
  2. Configure URL settings
  3. Click "Publish"
  4. Share your unique URL or set up custom domain

docs.title: Media Optimization
docs.text:
• Use high-resolution images (minimum 2000px wide)
  • Include a mix of photos, virtual stagings, and 360° tours
  • Limit gallery to 25-30 images for optimal loading speed

docs.title: Content Structure
docs.text:
• Place most important information above the fold
  • Use clear, scannable headings
  • Include neighborhood information
  • Add property features in bullet points

docs.title: SEO
docs.text:
• Fill out all meta descriptions
  • Use location-specific keywords
  • Add alt text to all images
  • Include property specifications in structured data

docs.title: Lead Generation
docs.text:
• Place contact forms strategically
  • Enable chat functionality
  • Include clear calls-to-action
  • Set up lead notification emails

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Supported browsers: Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+, Edge 80+
  • Minimum internet speed: 10 Mbps
  • Maximum media file size: 25MB per image

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
// Example API endpoint for creating new site
POST /api/v1/project-sites
{
  "property_id": "123456",
  "template_id": "modern-1",
  "domain_settings": {
    "custom_domain": "123main.com",
    "ssl_enabled": true
  }
}

docs.title: Performance Specs
docs.text:
• Page load time: < 3 seconds
  • Image optimization: automatic WebP conversion
  • CDN delivery: Global edge locations
  • SSL: Free SSL certificates included

docs.title: Storage Limits
docs.text:
• Standard plan: 10 active sites, 1GB storage per site
  • Professional plan: Unlimited sites, 5GB storage per site
  • Enterprise plan: Custom limits

docs.title: Custom Domain Setup
docs.text:
1. Add CNAME record pointing to sites.pictastic.ai
  2. Verify domain ownership
  3. Wait for SSL propagation (24-48 hours)
  4. Configure domain in site settings

For additional support or custom requirements, contact our technical team at support@pictastic.ai.

docs.title: 1. Feature Overview
docs.text:
Pictastic.ai is designed to run efficiently on modern systems while processing high-resolution real estate imagery. The platform supports:

  • Bulk image processing and management
  • AI-powered virtual staging
  • Real-time property photo editing
  • Cloud storage integration
  • Multi-user collaboration features

docs.title: Minimum System Requirements
docs.text:
• Operating System:
  • Windows 10/11 (64-bit)
  • macOS 11.0 or later

  • Linux (Ubuntu 20.04 or later)

  • Hardware:

  • Processor: Intel Core i5/AMD Ryzen 5 or better
  • RAM: 8GB minimum (16GB recommended)
  • Storage: 256GB SSD with at least 50GB free space

  • Graphics: DirectX 11 compatible GPU with 4GB VRAM

  • Network:

  • Broadband internet connection (10 Mbps minimum)
  • 20 Mbps+ recommended for optimal cloud features

docs.title: Installation Process
docs.text:
1. Download the installer from your account dashboard
  2. Run the installation package
  3. Follow the setup wizard prompts
  4. Login with your credentials

docs.title: System Configuration
docs.text:
# Recommended folder structure
/pictastic
  /projects
  /exports
  /templates
  /cache

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Clear cache regularly (Settings > Maintenance > Clear Cache)
  • Keep at least 20% free storage space
  • Close resource-intensive applications while processing
  • Use wired internet connection for large uploads

docs.title: Resource Management
docs.text:
• Batch process images during off-peak hours
  • Limit concurrent virtual staging jobs to 5
  • Export finished projects to external storage
  • Regular system maintenance and updates

docs.title: Supported File Formats
docs.text:
• Images: JPG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
  • Project Files: .PIC, .PSTA
  • Exports: JPG, PNG, TIFF, PDF

docs.title: Processing Specifications
docs.text:
Maximum Image Size: 50MB per file
Supported Resolution: Up to 8K (7680×4320)
Batch Processing: Up to 500 images
Virtual Staging: Up to 100 rooms per project

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
{
  "api_version": "2.0",
  "endpoint": "https://api.pictastic.ai/v2",
  "rate_limit": "100 requests/minute",
  "authentication": "OAuth 2.0"
}

docs.title: Security Requirements
docs.text:
• SSL/TLS encryption for all data transfers
  • Two-factor authentication support
  • Regular security updates
  • Compliance with GDPR and real estate data regulations

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
If experiencing performance issues: 1. Check system resources in Task Manager/Activity Monitor 2. Verify network connection speed 3. Clear application cache 4. Update graphics drivers 5. Contact support if issues persist

Note: System requirements may change with platform updates. Check the release notes for the latest specifications.

For additional support, contact technical support at support@pictastic.ai or visit our help center.

docs.title: 1. Feature Overview
docs.text: The system storage component of Pictastic.ai manages all media assets, including original photos, virtually staged images, and project files. It provides secure, scalable storage with fast access times and automatic backup capabilities.

docs.title: 2. Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Asset Management: Stores and organizes all types of media files (JPG, PNG, TIFF, etc.)
  • Version Control: Maintains multiple versions of edited images
  • Project Organization: Groups related files into project folders
  • Automatic Backup: Creates redundant copies across multiple storage locations
  • Access Control: Manages user permissions and sharing capabilities
  • File Recovery: Provides 30-day recovery for deleted files

docs.title: Uploading Files
docs.text:
Maximum file sizes:
- Images: 50MB per file
- Project files: 100MB per project
- Bulk uploads: 500MB per session

docs.title: Storage Organization
docs.text:
/projects/
    /{project_id}/
        /original/
        /staged/
        /drafts/
        /final/
    /shared/
    /archived/

docs.title: Managing Storage
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Dashboard > Storage Management
  2. Monitor usage through the storage metrics panel
  3. Use filters to sort files by date, size, or project
  4. Archive or delete unused files to free up space

docs.title: 4. Best Practices
docs.text:
• Regular Cleanup
  • Archive completed projects after 90 days
  • Delete unnecessary draft versions

  • Remove duplicate files

  • File Organization

  • Use consistent naming conventions
  • Maintain project folder structure

  • Tag files appropriately for easy search

  • Storage Optimization

  • Compress large files before uploading
  • Use recommended file formats (JPG for photos, PNG for renders)
  • Limit draft versions to essential iterations

docs.title: Storage Specifications
docs.text:
Total Storage Capacity:
- Basic Plan: 100GB
- Pro Plan: 500GB
- Enterprise Plan: 2TB+

File Format Support:
- Images: JPG, PNG, TIFF, RAW
- Documents: PDF, PSD
- Videos: MP4 (preview only)

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text:
• 256-bit AES encryption at rest
  • SSL/TLS encryption in transit
  • Multi-factor authentication for sensitive operations
  • Regular security audits and updates

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
Upload Speed: Up to 100Mbps
Download Speed: Up to 200Mbps
Access Time: <200ms
Availability: 99.9% uptime

docs.title: Backup System
docs.text:
• Real-time synchronization across multiple locations
  • Daily incremental backups
  • Weekly full backups
  • 30-day retention policy

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
# Example API call for storage status
GET /api/v1/storage/status
{
    "total_space": 500000000000,  # 500GB in bytes
    "used_space": 125000000000,   # 125GB in bytes
    "available_space": 375000000000,
    "usage_percentage": 25
}

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
Common Error Codes:
- 507: Insufficient Storage
- 413: File Too Large
- 415: Unsupported Media Type
- 429: Too Many Requests

For additional support or technical assistance, contact support@pictastic.ai or visit our developer portal at developers.pictastic.ai.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The System Trash feature in Pictastic.ai serves as a temporary storage location for deleted items, allowing users to recover accidentally deleted content or permanently remove items from the system. Items in trash are retained for 30 days before automatic permanent deletion.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Temporary storage of deleted items (photos, virtual stagings, floor plans)
  • Item recovery within 30-day retention period
  • Bulk restore and permanent delete options
  • Storage space management
  • Automatic cleanup of expired items

docs.title: Accessing Trash
docs.text:
1. Navigate to System Settings in the main menu
  2. Select "Trash" from the submenu
  3. View all deleted items sorted by deletion date

docs.title: Restoring Items
docs.text:
1. Select items you want to restore by checking the boxes
  2. Click "Restore Selected" button
  3. Choose destination folder (original location by default)
  4. Confirm restoration

docs.title: Permanent Deletion
docs.text:
1. Select items to delete
  2. Click "Delete Permanently" button
  3. Confirm deletion in the warning dialog

docs.title: Bulk Actions
docs.text:
• Use "Select All" to manage multiple items
  • Filter items by type, date, or project
  • Sort by size, date, or file name

docs.title: Storage Management
docs.text:
• Regularly review trash contents
  • Empty trash when storage space is limited
  • Restore important items promptly

docs.title: Organization
docs.text:
• Use filters to locate specific items
  • Check item details before permanent deletion
  • Consider downloading important items before deletion

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
• Only system administrators can access other users' deleted items
  • Regular users can only see their own deleted content
  • Enable notifications for automatic deletions

docs.title: Storage Specifications
docs.text:
• Maximum trash retention: 30 days
  • Storage limit: 20% of total account storage
  • File size limit: Same as original upload limits

docs.title: File Types Supported
docs.text:
• Images (.jpg, .png, .tiff)
  • Documents (.pdf)
  • Project files (.pst)
  • Virtual staging files (.vs)

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Minimum 10GB free storage space
  • Supported browsers: Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+
  • Internet connection: 5Mbps minimum

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/trash
POST /api/v1/trash/restore
DELETE /api/v1/trash/permanent
GET /api/v1/trash/status

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
• Insufficient storage space
  • File permission conflicts
  • Corrupted file recovery
  • Network timeout handling

docs.title: Automatic Cleanup
docs.text:
• Daily cleanup job runs at 00:00 UTC
  • Removes items older than 30 days
  • Generates system logs for deleted items
  • Sends notification to account admin

For additional support or technical assistance, contact Pictastic.ai support team at support@pictastic.ai.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Virtual staging allows you to transform empty rooms into fully furnished spaces using Pictastic.ai's AI-powered design tools. Create photorealistic interior designs by adding furniture, decor, and styling elements to your real estate photos.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• AI-powered furniture placement and scene composition
  • 4000+ furniture and decor items in the design library
  • Multiple design style presets (Modern, Traditional, Industrial, etc.)
  • Room-type specific staging options (Living Room, Bedroom, Kitchen, etc.)
  • Custom furniture arrangement and positioning
  • Lighting and shadow adjustment
  • Design save and reuse capabilities

docs.title: 1. Upload Your Photo
docs.text:
• Select "Create New Design" from the dashboard
  • Upload a high-resolution photo (minimum 1920x1080px)
  • Choose the room type category

docs.title: 2. Select Design Style
docs.text:
• Choose from available style presets or create custom style
  • Browse recommended furniture collections for selected style
  • Adjust style parameters if needed (color scheme, density, etc.)

docs.title: 3. Generate and Customize Design
docs.text:
a. Generate Initial Design
- Click "Generate Design" to create AI-suggested layout
- Wait 30-60 seconds for processing

b. Customize Elements
- Add/remove furniture pieces from library
- Adjust item positions using drag-and-drop
- Rotate and scale items as needed
- Fine-tune lighting and shadows

docs.title: 4. Save and Export
docs.text:
• Save design to your project library
  • Export in various resolutions (up to 4K)
  • Download in multiple formats (JPG, PNG, TIFF)

docs.title: Photo Quality
docs.text:
• Use high-resolution, well-lit photos
  • Ensure room is empty and clean
  • Shoot from corner angles for best results
  • Maintain consistent lighting conditions

docs.title: Design Creation
docs.text:
• Start with style presets for consistency
  • Maintain proper scale between furniture pieces
  • Consider traffic flow in furniture arrangement
  • Don't overcrowd the space
  • Use appropriate furniture for room size

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Limit active designs to 3-5 at once
  • Clear browser cache regularly
  • Use Chrome or Safari for best performance

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Modern web browser (Chrome 90+, Safari 14+, Firefox 88+)
  • Minimum 8GB RAM
  • Stable internet connection (10+ Mbps)
  • Display resolution: 1920x1080 or higher

docs.title: Input Image Specifications
docs.text:
• Formats: JPG, PNG
  • Resolution: 1920x1080px minimum, 4000x3000px recommended
  • File size: Up to 25MB
  • Color space: RGB

docs.title: Processing Capabilities
docs.text:
• AI processing time: 30-60 seconds per design
  • Maximum concurrent designs: 5
  • Auto-save interval: 2 minutes
  • Design history: 30 days

docs.title: Export Options
docs.text:
Resolution:
- Standard: 1920x1080px
- High: 2560x1440px
- Ultra: 3840x2160px (4K)

Formats:
- JPG (90% quality)
- PNG (lossless)
- TIFF (uncompressed)

Note: Feature availability may vary based on subscription level. Check your plan details for specific limitations.

For additional support, contact our technical team at support@pictastic.ai or visit our help center.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The Virtual Staging Credits system allows users to purchase and manage credits for virtual staging services within Pictastic.ai. Credits are the platform's currency for processing virtual staging requests, with different staging types requiring varying amounts of credits.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Credit purchase and management
  • Real-time credit balance tracking
  • Automated credit deduction for staging services
  • Bulk credit purchasing options
  • Credit usage history and reporting
  • Enterprise credit pool management

docs.title: Purchasing Credits
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Credits & Pricing section
  2. Select a credit package:
  3. Starter (100 credits): $199
  4. Professional (500 credits): $899
  5. Enterprise (1000+ credits): Custom pricing
  6. Complete payment through secure checkout
  7. Credits are instantly added to your account

docs.title: Checking Credit Balance
docs.text:
1. Log into your Pictastic.ai account
  2. View current balance in the top navigation bar
  3. Access detailed credit history in Account Settings > Credits

docs.title: Credit Costs Per Service
docs.text: Service Type Credits Required Basic Room Staging 2 credits Advanced Staging 3 credits Style Change 2 credits Furniture Removal 1 credit Outdoor Staging 3 credits

docs.title: Credit Management
docs.text:
• Monitor credit balance regularly
  • Set up low-balance alerts (minimum 20 credits recommended)
  • Purchase credits in bulk for better pricing
  • Review credit usage reports monthly

docs.title: Enterprise Users
docs.text:
• Assign credit pool administrators
  • Set up department-specific credit allocations
  • Enable credit usage notifications
  • Implement approval workflows for large credit purchases

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/credits/balance
POST /api/v1/credits/purchase
GET /api/v1/credits/history

docs.title: Credit System Architecture
docs.text:
• Real-time credit tracking system
  • Automatic credit deduction upon service completion
  • Failed staging attempts do not consume credits
  • Credit expiration: 12 months from purchase date

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
• SSL encryption for all transactions
  • Two-factor authentication for large credit purchases
  • Audit trail for all credit-related activities

docs.title: Enterprise Integration
docs.text:
{
  "enterprise_features": {
    "sso_support": true,
    "credit_pool_management": true,
    "usage_reporting": true,
    "api_access": true
  }
}

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text:
• Maximum 10,000 credits per single purchase
  • Maximum 100 simultaneous staging requests
  • Credit balance updates within 30 seconds of transaction

For additional support or custom enterprise solutions, contact support@pictastic.ai

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: The Design Styles feature in Pictastic.ai's virtual staging system allows users to transform empty rooms into fully furnished spaces using various pre-defined interior design themes. Each style has been carefully curated to reflect current market trends and appeal to different buyer demographics.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• 15+ premium design styles including Modern, Contemporary, Scandinavian, Industrial, Traditional, and more
  • AI-powered furniture and decor placement
  • Style-specific color palettes and material selections
  • Automatic room recognition and scaling
  • Style mixing capabilities for custom looks
  • Real-time preview of different styles

docs.title: Applying a Design Style
docs.text:
1. Upload your empty room photo
  2. Select "Virtual Staging" from the main menu
  3. Choose "Design Styles" from the staging options
  4. Browse available styles in the style gallery
  5. Click on a style to preview it in your space
  6. Adjust style settings if needed:
  7. Furniture density (sparse to full)
  8. Color intensity
  9. Decor amount
  10. Click "Apply Style" to generate the staged image

docs.title: Customizing Styles
docs.text:
To modify a base style:
1. Select your base style
2. Open "Style Settings"
3. Adjust parameters:
   - Primary colors
   - Secondary colors
   - Furniture types
   - Decor elements
4. Save as custom preset (optional)

docs.title: Style Selection
docs.text:
• Match the style to your target market demographic
  • Consider the property's architecture and existing features
  • Use consistent styles across multiple rooms in the same property
  • Avoid overly trendy styles for broad market appeal

docs.title: Image Preparation
docs.text:
• Ensure rooms are completely empty
  • Shoot at eye level (4-5 feet from the floor)
  • Capture the entire room with wide-angle shots
  • Maintain good lighting conditions
  • Remove any unwanted items or imperfections

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
• Use recommended image dimensions (minimum 1920x1080px)
  • Keep file sizes under 10MB for faster processing
  • Process multiple rooms in batch for efficiency
  • Save frequently used styles as presets

docs.title: Supported File Formats
docs.text:
• Input: JPG, PNG, TIFF
  • Output: JPG, PNG
  • Maximum resolution: 4096x4096px
  • Minimum resolution: 1280x720px

docs.title: Style Processing
docs.text:
{
  "styleParameters": {
    "furnitureDensity": 0.0-1.0,
    "colorIntensity": 0.0-1.0,
    "decorAmount": 0.0-1.0,
    "styleBlending": 0.0-1.0
  }
}

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Browser: Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+
  • Internet connection: 10+ Mbps recommended
  • Screen resolution: 1920x1080 or higher recommended

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
# Example API call for style application
POST /api/v1/virtual-staging/apply-style
{
  "image_id": "string",
  "style_id": "string",
  "parameters": {
    "furniture_density": float,
    "color_intensity": float,
    "decor_amount": float
  }
}

docs.title: Performance Metrics
docs.text:
• Average processing time: 30-60 seconds per room
  • Style switching time: 2-3 seconds
  • Maximum batch processing: 10 rooms
  • Style preview generation: 5-10 seconds

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
• Invalid room detection: Auto-notification with correction suggestions
  • Style compatibility issues: Warning with alternative style recommendations
  • Processing failures: Automatic retry up to 3 times
  • Network interruptions: Auto-save of progress and resume capability

For additional support or custom style requirements, contact our technical support team at support@pictastic.ai.

docs.title: Feature Overview
docs.text: Virtual staging allows real estate professionals to digitally furnish and decorate empty rooms using Pictastic.ai's AI-powered staging technology. This feature helps showcase a property's potential by adding realistic furniture, decor, and design elements without physical staging costs.

docs.title: Key Functionality
docs.text:
• Room Type Selection: Stage different room types including:
  • Living rooms
  • Bedrooms
  • Dining rooms
  • Home offices
  • Kitchens

  • Outdoor spaces

  • Style Options:

  • Modern
  • Traditional
  • Contemporary
  • Scandinavian
  • Industrial
  • Coastal

  • Minimalist

  • Furniture Control:

  • Add/remove individual furniture pieces
  • Adjust furniture placement
  • Scale and rotate items
  • Customize colors and materials

docs.title: 1. Upload Images
docs.text:
Supported formats: JPG, PNG
Maximum file size: 20MB
Minimum resolution: 1024x1024 pixels

docs.title: 2. Select Room Type
docs.text:
1. Choose the appropriate room category
  2. Select desired style preset
  3. Adjust room parameters (size, layout, lighting)

docs.title: 3. Generate Staging
docs.text:
1. Click "Generate Staging"
  2. Wait for AI processing (typically 30-60 seconds)
  3. Review results
  4. Make adjustments as needed

docs.title: 4. Export
docs.text:
• Download in various resolutions
  • Save projects for future editing
  • Batch export multiple rooms

docs.title: Image Quality
docs.text:
• Use high-resolution photos (recommended: 3000x2000 pixels or higher)
  • Ensure proper lighting in original photos
  • Shoot rooms from corner angles for best results
  • Keep vertical lines straight
  • Clean empty rooms before photographing

docs.title: Style Selection
docs.text:
• Match staging style to property type and target market
  • Maintain consistent style across all rooms
  • Use appropriate furniture scale for room size
  • Don't overcrowd spaces

docs.title: Common Issues to Avoid
docs.text:
• Extreme camera angles
  • Poor lighting conditions
  • Reflective surfaces in view
  • Partially furnished rooms
  • Moving objects in frame

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
Supported browsers:
- Chrome (version 90+)
- Firefox (version 88+)
- Safari (version 14+)
- Edge (version 90+)

Minimum internet speed: 10 Mbps
Recommended RAM: 8GB or higher

docs.title: Processing Specifications
docs.text:
• AI Model: Proprietary deep learning architecture
  • Average processing time: 45 seconds per room
  • Maximum concurrent jobs: 5 per account
  • Output resolution: Up to 4K (3840x2160)

docs.title: API Integration
docs.text:
// Example API endpoint
POST /api/v1/virtual-staging/generate
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

Parameters:
- image_file: File
- room_type: String
- style: String
- furniture_density: Float (0.0-1.0)

docs.title: Storage and Retention
docs.text:
• Projects saved for 30 days
  • Original images retained for 90 days
  • Maximum project storage: 100GB per account
  • Automatic backup every 12 hours

For specific implementation details and advanced features, please refer to our API Documentation and Developer Guide.
